Package org.apache.rampart.policy.model

Class KerberosConfig

java.lang.Object
org.apache.rampart.policy.model.KerberosConfig
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.neethi.Assertion, org.apache.neethi.PolicyComponent
public class KerberosConfig extends Object implements org.apache.neethi.Assertion
Container for Kerberos configuration options.

    • HOST_BASED_NAME_FORM

      public static final String HOST_BASED_NAME_FORM
      Specifies that the service principal name should be interpreted as a "host-based" name as specified in GSS API RFC, section "4.1: Host-Based Service Name Form". See rfc2743 - GSS API, Version 2.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • USERNAME_NAME_FORM

      public static final String USERNAME_NAME_FORM
      Specifies that the service principal name should be interpreted as a "username" name as specified in GSS API RFC, section "4.2: User Name Form". See rfc2743 - GSS API, Version 2.

  • Method Details

    • getJaasContext

      public String getJaasContext()
      Returns:
      The JAAS context name to use to obtain a TGT (Ticket granting ticket).

    • setJaasContext

      public void setJaasContext(String jaasContext)
      Sets the JAAS context name to use to obtain a TGT (Ticket granting ticket).
      Parameters:
      jaasContext - the jaasContext to set

    • getPrincipalName

      public String getPrincipalName()
      Returns:
      The principal name to use to obtain a TGT (Ticket granting ticket). This is usually the domain username. If not specified, Rampart will fall back to the Rampart configuration's user. Note that the principal name specified in JAAS configuration takes precedence over any principal name configured here.

    • setPrincipalName

      public void setPrincipalName(String principalName)
      Sets the principal name to use to obtain a TGT (Ticket granting ticket). This is usually the domain username. If* not specified, Rampart will fall back to the Rampart configuration's user. Note that the principal name specified in JAAS configuration takes precedence over any principal name configured via this method.
      Parameters:
      principalName - the principalName to set

    • getPrincipalPassword

      public String getPrincipalPassword()
      Returns:
      Returns the principal's clear-text password. If the password is not configured (null), Rampart will try to obtain it from any configured password callback. Note that any principal password configured here will be ignored if the JAAS configuration configures usage of a keytab file.

    • setPrincipalPassword

      public void setPrincipalPassword(String principalPassword)
      Sets the principal's clear-text password. If the password is not configured (null), Rampart will try to obtain it from any configured password callback. Note that any principal password configured here will be ignored if the JAAS configuration configures usage of a keytab file.
      Parameters:
      principalPassword - clear-text password

    • getServicePrincipalName

      public String getServicePrincipalName()
      Returns:
      The service principal name to use to obtain a service ticket on the client-side. Note that by default, * this name is assumed to be in a HOST_BASED_NAME_FORM unless the service principal name form is explicitly configured.

    • setServicePrincipalName

      public void setServicePrincipalName(String servicePrincipalName)
      Sets service principal name to use to obtain a service ticket on the client-side. Note that by default, this name is assumed to be in a HOST_BASED_NAME_FORM unless the service principal name form is explicitly configured.
      Parameters:
      servicePrincipalName - service principal name

    • getServicePrincipalNameForm

      public String getServicePrincipalNameForm()
      Returns the service principal name form.
      Returns:
      Either "hostbased" or "username". Default is: "hostbased".

    • setKerberosTokenDecoderClass

      public void setKerberosTokenDecoderClass(String kerberosTokenDecoderClass)
      Configures a Kerberos token decoder implementation for decoding Kerberos v5 tokens on server side. The decoder will be used only if the Kerberos client/server session key cannot be obtained using Java's ExtendedGSSContext API, which is normally the case when using Java version older than 1.7.0_b07, see JDK-6710360 : export Kerberos session key to applications.

      The class will be loaded using current service's classloader.

      Parameters:
      kerberosTokenDecoderClass - A fully qualifier class name that implements KerberosTokenValidator.

    • getKerberosTokenDecoderClass

      public String getKerberosTokenDecoderClass()
      Returns the Kerberos token decoder implementation for decoding Kerberos v5 tokens on server side. The decoder will be used only if the Kerberos client/server session key cannot be obtained using Java's ExtendedGSSContext API, which is normally the case when using Java version older than 1.7.0_b07, see JDK-6710360 : export Kerberos session key to applications
      Returns:
      A fully qualifier class name that implements KerberosTokenValidator or null if no Kerberos token decoder is configured.

    • setServicePrincipalNameForm

      public void setServicePrincipalNameForm(String servicePrincipalNameForm) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the service principal name form.
      Parameters:
      servicePrincipalNameForm - The service principal name form to set. The given literal must be either "hostbased" or "username".
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the given servicePrincipalNameForm is not one of: "hostbased" or "username".

    • isRequstCredentialDelegation

      public boolean isRequstCredentialDelegation()
      If Kerberos credential delegation is requested, the initiator's TGT (Ticket granting ticket) is propagated to the receiver along with the TGS(Ticket granting service).
      Returns:
      true if credential delegation is requested.

    • setRequstCredentialDelegation

      public void setRequstCredentialDelegation(boolean requstCredentialDelegation)
      Enables Kerberos credential delegation. If credential delegation is requested, the initiator's TGT (Ticket granting ticket) is propagated to the receiver along with the TGS(Ticket granting service).

      Enabling delegation requires forwardable=true property to be added to the [libdefaults] section in the Kerberos setup configuration.KDC should also be explicitly configured to allow delegation as it is considered a security issue and is disabled by default.

      Parameters:
      requstCredentialDelegation - if true, credential delegation is requested.

    • getDelegationCredential

      public GSSCredential getDelegationCredential()
      The delegation credential is available when the initiator has explicitly requested delegation through setRequstCredentialDelegation(boolean) and the receiver has retrieved it and set it through setDelegationCredential(GSSCredential). If available, the delegation credential is used by the receiver to obtain a service ticket for another Kerberos protected WS on behalf of the initiator. The receiver's principal must have explicit privileges to use the delegated credential(TGT) for retrieval of the service ticket.
      Returns:
      the client's TGT wrapped in GSSCredential

    • setDelegationCredential

      public void setDelegationCredential(GSSCredential delegationCredential)
      Sets the delegation credential to be used by the receiver to obtain a service ticket for another Kerberos protected WS on behalf of the initiator. The receiver's principal must have explicit privileges to use the delegated credential(TGT) for retrieval of the service ticket.
      Parameters:
      delegationCredential - the GSSCredential to use for obtaining a TGS
